questions.question: What is an INNER JOIN in SQL?
options: Returns all records from both tables
Returns matching records from both tables
questions.answer: Returns matching records from both tables

questions.question: Which keyword is used for an INNER JOIN?
questions.answer: INNER JOIN

questions.question: What condition is used in an INNER JOIN?
questions.answer: ON

questions.question: Can INNER JOIN combine more than two tables?
questions.answer: Yes

questions.question: Which clause specifies how tables are related?
questions.answer: ON

questions.question: What happens if there is no match in INNER JOIN?
questions.answer: Excludes the row

questions.question: Which is a valid INNER JOIN syntax?
options: SELECT * FROM a INNER JOIN b ON a.id = b.id;
questions.answer: SELECT * FROM a INNER JOIN b ON a.id = b.id;

questions.question: Can you join on multiple conditions?
questions.answer: Yes

questions.question: What is the result of an INNER JOIN with no common values?
questions.answer: Empty result

questions.question: Which clause is required with INNER JOIN?
questions.answer: ON

questions.question: Join `employees` and `departments` on `dept_id`.
options: SELECT * FROM employees INNER JOIN departments ON employees.dept_id = departments.dept_id;
questions.answer: SELECT * FROM employees INNER JOIN departments ON employees.dept_id = departments.dept_id;

questions.question: Fetch student names and course names from `students` and `courses` tables using `course_id`.
options: SELECT students.name, courses.title FROM students INNER JOIN courses ON students.course_id = courses.course_id;
SELECT name, title FROM students JOIN courses;
JOIN students AND courses ON course_id;
SELECT * FROM students INNER JOIN courses;
questions.answer: SELECT students.name, courses.title FROM students INNER JOIN courses ON students.course_id = courses.course_id;

questions.question: List orders with customer names using `customer_id`.
options: SELECT orders.id, customers.name FROM orders INNER JOIN customers ON orders.customer_id = customers.customer_id;
SELECT id, name FROM orders JOIN customers;
SELECT name, id FROM customers INNER JOIN orders;
questions.answer: SELECT orders.id, customers.name FROM orders INNER JOIN customers ON orders.customer_id = customers.customer_id;

questions.question: Get product and supplier info from `products` and `suppliers` using `supplier_id`.
options: SELECT products.name, suppliers.name FROM products INNER JOIN suppliers ON products.supplier_id = suppliers.supplier_id;
SELECT name FROM suppliers INNER JOIN products;
SELECT products JOIN suppliers ON supplier_id;
questions.answer: SELECT products.name, suppliers.name FROM products INNER JOIN suppliers ON products.supplier_id = suppliers.supplier_id;

questions.question: Join `books` and `authors` on `author_id` and display book title and author name.
options: SELECT books.title, authors.name FROM books INNER JOIN authors ON books.author_id = authors.author_id;
SELECT title, name FROM authors JOIN books;
questions.answer: SELECT books.title, authors.name FROM books INNER JOIN authors ON books.author_id = authors.author_id;

questions.question: Get employees and their managers using `manager_id`.
options: SELECT e.name, m.name FROM employees e INNER JOIN employees m ON e.manager_id = m.id;
SELECT name FROM employees WHERE manager_id;
JOIN employees e AND m ON e.manager_id;
SELECT * FROM employees INNER JOIN manager;
questions.answer: SELECT e.name, m.name FROM employees e INNER JOIN employees m ON e.manager_id = m.id;

questions.question: Join `students` and `results` using `student_id` to display names and marks.
options: SELECT students.name, results.marks FROM students INNER JOIN results ON students.student_id = results.student_id;
SELECT name, marks FROM students JOIN results;
questions.answer: SELECT students.name, results.marks FROM students INNER JOIN results ON students.student_id = results.student_id;

questions.question: Combine employee salary info with department names.
options: SELECT e.salary, d.name FROM employees e INNER JOIN departments d ON e.dept_id = d.id;
SELECT salary FROM employees JOIN departments;
SELECT e.name, d.salary FROM departments INNER JOIN employees;
JOIN employees and departments ON salary;
questions.answer: SELECT e.salary, d.name FROM employees e INNER JOIN departments d ON e.dept_id = d.id;

questions.question: Get order details with product names.
options: SELECT o.id, p.name FROM orders o INNER JOIN products p ON o.product_id = p.id;
SELECT o.id FROM orders JOIN products;
SELECT name FROM products JOIN orders;
questions.answer: SELECT o.id, p.name FROM orders o INNER JOIN products p ON o.product_id = p.id;

questions.question: Show class names and teacher names from `classes` and `teachers` using `teacher_id`.
options: SELECT classes.name, teachers.name FROM classes INNER JOIN teachers ON classes.teacher_id = teachers.id;
SELECT name FROM teachers JOIN classes;
SELECT * FROM classes INNER JOIN teachers;
questions.answer: SELECT classes.name, teachers.name FROM classes INNER JOIN teachers ON classes.teacher_id = teachers.id;
